questions.text: When was the Pakistan Resolution passed?
questions.explanation: The Lahore Resolution, commonly known as the Pakistan Resolution, was passed on March 23, 1940, at the annual session of the All-India Muslim League.

questions.text: Who was the first Prime Minister of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Liaquat Ali Khan served as the first Prime Minister of Pakistan from 1947 until his assassination in 1951.

questions.text: The first Constitution of Pakistan was adopted in which year?
questions.explanation: The first Constitution of Pakistan was adopted on March 23, 1956, declaring Pakistan an Islamic Republic.

questions.text: Which mountain is the highest peak in Pakistan?
questions.explanation: K2 (8,611 meters) is the highest peak in Pakistan and the second-highest mountain in the world after Mount Everest.

questions.text: The 18th Amendment to the Constitution was passed in which year?
questions.explanation: The 18th Amendment was passed on April 8, 2010, making significant changes to Pakistan's federal structure and provincial autonomy.

questions.text: Which river is NOT part of the Indus River System?
questions.explanation: The Brahmaputra River flows through Tibet, India, and Bangladesh but is not part of Pakistan's Indus River System.
China is Pakistan's largest trading partner and a key ally in economic and strategic matters.

questions.text: The Indus Water Treaty was signed between Pakistan and India in which year?
questions.explanation: The Indus Water Treaty was signed on September 19, 1960, with the World Bank as a mediator, dividing the rivers between Pakistan and India.

questions.text: What is the main export of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Textile products, particularly cotton-based textiles, constitute the largest share of Pakistan's exports.

questions.text: The Two-Nation Theory was presented by which leader?
questions.explanation: The Two-Nation Theory was first articulated by Sir Syed Ahmed Khan in the 19th century, later developed by Allama Iqbal and championed by Quaid-e-Azam.
